result.execSummary:
The defendant GEANIE M WILSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid within 60 days of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  *** DUE TO COVID-19 PANDEMIC CALL 920-236-4906 BEFORE REPORTING TO THE COURTHOUSE.  HAVE YOUR COURT PAPERWORK IN HAND WHEN YOU MAKE THE CALL.  STAFF WILL GIVE YOU FURTHER DIRECTIONS.***Immediately following court, please report to:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. GEANIE M WILSON
